p: The fresh, flowering herb of A. absinthium is classified in the European Pharmacopoeia and the French Pharmacopoeia as a homeopathic raw material. The tincture produced should contain a minimum of 0.05% w/ w derivatives of hydroxycinnamic acid, expressed in terms of chlorogenic acid [ 70]. In homeopathy, the plant is recommended for hallucinations, nightmares, nervousness, insomnia, dizziness, and epileptic seizures [ 71].
